topics.title: Amplifier Performance
topics.description: The speaker discusses the performance of an amplifier using an LM386 chip, including its power output and limitations.
evidence_quotes: I probably can get, um, somewhere between .6 and .7 watts out of this thing.

topics.title: Decoupling Cap
topics.description: The importance of decoupling capacitors in signal grounds
evidence_quotes: [00:08:45.000 → 00:08:55.000] And, that little bit of resistance in the conductor will mean that that's going to raise a point here.
[00:08:57.000 → 00:08:59.000] And, it's going to cause distortion.

topics.title: Measuring Power Output
topics.description: The speaker explains how to measure the power output of an amplifier using RMS voltage and load impedance, and provides some calculations.
evidence_quotes: Divided by our load impedance of 8 ohms.

topics.title: Signal Ground Isolation
topics.description: The need for signal grounds to be isolated from power supply grounds
evidence_quotes: [00:08:31.000 → 00:08:36.000] So, you don't have any of those power grounds conducting in the input ground.
[00:09:25.000 → 00:09:32.000] And, here is the grounds for the signal.

topics.title: Volume Control Steps
topics.description: The speaker discusses how the volume controls on some devices step in discrete levels, which can be a problem. They mention that it would be better if they didn't have to deal with this and suggest adding a potentiometer.
evidence_quotes: Because, the way the volume controls on these, they step in discrete levels.
Like, add a potentiometer or something.
